name: Floodplain Permeability
functionStatement: Surface water-groundwater exchange moderates temperature, transforms nutrients, supplies oxygen, and supports aquatic life.
descriptionMarkdown: Floodplain soils allow hyporheic/groundwater exchange, consistent with local reference.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Assess soil texture and permeability in the floodplain using a hand texture test or auger. Use soils GIS as a desktop proxy where field access is limited.

inputs.label: Floodplain Permeability
inputs.helpMarkdown: GIS Soils data (SSURGO); High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Permeable floodplain soils that support subsurface flow. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Partially permeable soils or some clogging. (Suggested index range 0.50-0.69)

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Mostly fine fill or bedrock that limits infiltration. (Suggested index range 0.30-0.49)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Heavily compacted or lined soils with minimal subsurface exchange. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)

references: SSURGO or gSSURGO soils (HSG, Ksat, texture)

sourceMetadata.metricDataSource: GIS Soils data (SSURGO); High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence
